skill.name: azure-storage
skill.description: Azure Storage Services including Blob Storage, File Shares, Queue Storage, Table Storage, and Data Lake. Provides object storage, SMB file shares, async messaging, NoSQL key-value, and big data analytics capabilities. Includes access tiers (hot, cool, archive) and lifecycle management.
skill.summary: Official Microsoft skill for Azure Storage services including Blob, Files, Queue, Tables, and Data Lake with MCP tools and CLI commands.
skill.author: microsoft

security_audit.summary: All 146 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. This is an official Microsoft skill containing only markdown documentation files with SDK usage examples. The scanner detected patterns in documentation that appear similar to security issues but are actually standard markdown code formatting (backticks), legitimate Azure documentation URLs, and Go import statements. No executable code, scripts, or malicious patterns exist.

high_findings.title: False Positive: Ruby/Shell Backtick Execution
high_findings.description: The scanner detected 'Ruby/shell backtick execution' in 119 locations. These are markdown documentation files using backticks (`) for code block formatting, not actual shell execution. Examples: `az storage blob list`, `dotnet add package`. This is standard markdown syntax.

high_findings.title: False Positive: Hardcoded URLs
high_findings.description: The scanner detected 'Hardcoded URLs' in 18 locations. These are legitimate Azure documentation URLs (learn.microsoft.com) and placeholder storage endpoint examples (https://ACCOUNT.blob.core.windows.net/) used for instructional purposes. Not security vulnerabilities.

high_findings.title: False Positive: Dynamic Import Expression
high_findings.description: The scanner detected 'Dynamic import() expression' at references/sdk-usage.md:83. This is Go code's 'import (' statement in a code example, not JavaScript dynamic import. Documentation content only.

high_findings.title: False Positive: Weak Cryptographic Algorithm
high_findings.description: The scanner flagged 'Weak cryptographic algorithm' in 8 locations. This appears to be a scanner misidentification - no cryptographic algorithms exist in these documentation files. The skill contains only Azure Storage SDK reference documentation.

content.value_statement: This official Microsoft skill provides comprehensive guidance for Azure Storage services including Blob, Files, Queue, Tables, and Data Lake. It offers MCP tools integration and CLI commands to help developers manage cloud storage resources efficiently.
actual_capabilities: List and manage Azure Blob Storage containers and blobs
Manage Azure File Shares with SMB protocol
Work with Azure Queue Storage for async messaging
Query Azure Table Storage for NoSQL key-value data
Access Azure Data Lake for big data analytics
Use Azure CLI commands for storage operations
limitations: MCP server must be enabled for tool integration
Some features require specific Azure regions
CLI fallback needed when MCP is not configured

use_cases.title: Cloud Storage Management
use_cases.description: List storage accounts, containers, and blobs in Azure subscriptions. Upload and download blob content using MCP tools or CLI commands.
use_cases.target_user: DevOps engineers managing Azure cloud storage

use_cases.title: Application Data Storage
use_cases.description: Integrate Azure Storage SDKs into applications. Use Blob Storage for unstructured data, Queue Storage for async processing, and Table Storage for NoSQL data.

use_cases.title: Data Migration and Backup
use_cases.description: Set up file shares for lift-and-shift scenarios. Configure redundancy options (LRS, ZRS, GRS, GZRS) for disaster recovery and durability requirements.

prompt_templates.title: List Storage Accounts
prompt_templates.prompt: List all storage accounts in my Azure subscription using the azure-storage skill.

prompt_templates.title: Upload Blob to Container
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I upload a file to Azure Blob Storage using Python? Show the SDK code.
prompt_templates.scenario: Learning blob upload with Python SDK

prompt_templates.title: Create File Share
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new Azure File Share with SMB access. What are the CLI commands?

prompt_templates.title: Configure Blob Lifecycle
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up blob access tiers (hot, cool, archive) and lifecycle management policies.

output_examples.input: List containers in my storage account
output_examples.output: The skill provides MCP tools (azure__storage) or CLI fallback commands like: az storage container list --account-name ACCOUNT --output table

output_examples.input: Upload a blob using Python SDK
output_examples.output: Code example using azure-storage-blob SDK with ContainerClient and BlobClient to upload content to Azure Blob Storage
LRS (11 nines, local), ZRS (12 nines, regional), GRS (16 nines, geo-redundant), GZRS (16 nines with regional failover)

best_practices: Use managed identities instead of storage keys for authentication
Enable soft delete for blob containers to prevent data loss
Use appropriate access tiers (Hot/Cool/Archive) to optimize costs
anti_patterns: Do not hardcode storage account keys in source code
Avoid using public access blobs for sensitive data
Do not skip redundancy options for production data

faq.question: What Azure Storage services are supported?
faq.answer: Blob Storage, File Shares, Queue Storage, Table Storage, and Data Lake are all supported with MCP tools and CLI commands.

faq.question: Do I need Azure MCP server enabled?
faq.answer: MCP is preferred for tool integration. Run /azure:setup or enable via /mcp. CLI fallback is available when MCP is not configured.

faq.question: What programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: SDKs are available for .NET, Java, JavaScript/TypeScript, Python, Go, and Rust with code examples in the skill.

faq.question: How do I choose between storage tiers?
faq.answer: Use Hot for frequent access, Cool for 30+ days, Cold for 90+ days, and Archive for 180+ days of infrequent data.

faq.question: What redundancy option should I use?
faq.answer: LRS for dev/test, ZRS for regional HA, GRS for disaster recovery, GZRS for maximum durability.

faq.question: Is this skill official Microsoft?
faq.answer: Yes, this is an official Microsoft skill from the GitHub Copilot for Azure repository.
